   20: 
   21: %%
   22: -module(erl_call_SUITE).
   23: 
   24: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   25: 
   26: -export([all/0, smoke/1,
   27:          random_cnode_name/1,
   28:          test_connect_to_host_port/1,
   29:          unresolvable_hostname/1,
   30:          timeout/1,
   31:          test_fetch_stdout/1]).
   32: 
   33: all() ->
   34:     [smoke,
   35:      random_cnode_name,
   36:      test_connect_to_host_port,
   37:      unresolvable_hostname,
   38:      timeout,
   39:      test_fetch_stdout].
   40: 
   41: smoke(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   42:     Name = atom_to_list(?MODULE)
   43:         ++ "-"
   44:         ++ integer_to_list(erlang:system_time(microsecond)),
   45: 
   46:     RetNodeName = start_node_and_get_node_name(Name),
   47: 
   48:     halt_node(Name),
   49: 
   50:     [_, Hostname] = string:lexemes(atom_to_list(node()), "@"),
   51:     NodeName = list_to_atom(Name ++ "@" ++ Hostname),
   52:     NodeName = list_to_atom(RetNodeName),
   53:     ok.
   54: 
   55: 
   56: random_cnode_name(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   57:     Name = atom_to_list(?MODULE)
   58:         ++ "-"
   59:         ++ integer_to_list(erlang:system_time(microsecond)),
   60: 
   61:     try
   62:         CNodeName = start_node_and_get_c_node_name(Name, []),
   63:         [_, Hostname] = string:lexemes(atom_to_list(node()), "@"),
   64:         DefaultName = list_to_atom("c17@" ++ Hostname),
   65:         check_eq(CNodeName, DefaultName),
   66: 
   67:         CNodeName_r = start_node_and_get_c_node_name(Name, ["-r"]),
   68:         [CNode_r, Hostname] = string:lexemes(atom_to_list(CNodeName_r), "@"),
   69:         check_regex(CNode_r, "^c[0-9]+$"),
   70: 
   71:         CNodeName_R = start_node_and_get_c_node_name(Name, ["-R"]),
   72:         [CNode_R, Hostname] = string:lexemes(atom_to_list(CNodeName_R), "@"),
   73:         check_regex(CNode_R, "^[0-9A-Z]+$"),
   74: 
   75:         %% we should get the same recycled node name again
   76:         CNodeName_R2 = start_node_and_get_c_node_name(Name, ["-R"]),
   77:         check_eq(CNodeName_R, CNodeName_R2),
   78: 
   79:         %% Check that it works with static ports using address
   80:         {ok,Nodes} = erl_epmd:names('localhost'),
   81:         Port = proplists:get_value(nodename(),Nodes),
   82:         MyName = get_node_name_from_self(
   83:                          ["-R","-address","localhost:"++integer_to_list(Port)]),
   84:         check_eq(MyName, node())
   85: 
   86:     after
   87:         halt_node(Name)
   88:     end,
   89:     ok.
   90: 
   91: nodename() ->
   92:     hd(string:split(atom_to_list(node()), "@")).
   93: 
   94: check_eq(X,Y) ->
   95:     {Y,X} = {X,Y}.
   96: 
   97: check_regex(String, Regex) ->
   98:     {ok, RE} = re:compile(Regex),
   99:     {{match,[{0,_}]}, _} = {re:run(String, RE), String},
  100:     true.
  101: 
  102: test_connect_to_host_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  103:     Name = atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  104:         ++ "-"
  105:         ++ integer_to_list(erlang:system_time(microsecond)),
  106:     try
  107:         test_connect_to_host_port_do(Name)
  108:     after
  109:         halt_node(Name)
  110:     end,
  111:     ok.
  112: 
  113: 
  114: test_connect_to_host_port_do(Name) ->
  115:     Port = start_node_and_get_port(Name),
  116:     AddressCaller =
  117:         fun(Address) ->
  118:                   get_erl_call_result(["-address",
  119:                                        Address,
  120:                                        "-a",
  121:                                        "erlang length [[1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9]]"])
  122:         end,
  123:     "9" = AddressCaller(erlang:integer_to_list(Port)),
  124:     "9" = AddressCaller(":" ++ erlang:integer_to_list(Port)),
  125:     [_, Hostname] = string:lexemes(atom_to_list(node()), "@"),
  126:     "9" = AddressCaller(Hostname ++ ":" ++ erlang:integer_to_list(Port)),
  127:     FailedRes = AddressCaller("80"),
  128:     case string:find(FailedRes, "80") of
  129:         nomatch -> ct:fail("Incorrect error message");
  130:         _ -> ok
  131:     end,
  132:     ok.
  133: 
  134: test_fetch_stdout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  135:     Name = atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  136:         ++ "-"
  137:         ++ "fetch_stdout"
  138:         ++ "-"
  139:         ++ integer_to_list(erlang:system_time(microsecond)),
  140:     try
  141:         test_fetch_stdout_do(Name)
  142:     after
  143:         halt_node(Name)
  144:     end,
  145:     ok.
  146: 
  147: 
  148: test_fetch_stdout_do(Name) ->
  149:     Port = start_node_and_get_port(Name),
  150:     %% Test that the -fetch_stdout option works
  151:     "hejok" = get_erl_call_result(["-address",
  152:                                    erlang:integer_to_list(Port),
  153:                                    "-a",
  154:                                    "io format [[104,101,106]]",
  155:                                    "-fetch_stdout"]),
  156:     %% Test that the -fetch_stdout option works together with
  157:     %% -no_result_term
  158:     "hej" = get_erl_call_result(["-address",
  159:                                  erlang:integer_to_list(Port),
  160:                                  "-a",
  161:                                  "io format [[104,101,106]]",
  162:                                  "-fetch_stdout",
  163:                                  "-no_result_term"]),
  164:     %% Test that we can print several times
  165:     MultiPrintCodeStr =
  166:         "io:format(\"hej\"),io:format(\"hej\"),io:format(\"hej\").\n",
  167:     "hejhejhej" = get_erl_call_result(["-address",
  168:                                    erlang:integer_to_list(Port),
  169:                                    "-a",
  170:                                    erlang_eval_call_string(MultiPrintCodeStr),
  171:                                    "-fetch_stdout",
  172:                                    "-no_result_term"]),
  173:     %% Test that we can print from a sub-process
  174:     SubProcPrintStr =
  175:         "begin\n"
  176:         "    P = self(),\n"
  177:         "    Printer = fun() ->\n"
  178:         "                      io:format(\"subhej\"),\n"
  179:         "                      receive\n"
  180:         "                          hej -> P ! hej\n"
  181:         "                      end\n"
  182:         "              end,\n"
  183:         "    PrinterPid = spawn(Printer),\n"
  184:         "    PrinterPid ! hej,\n"
  185:         "    receive\n"
  186:         "        hej -> ok\n"
  187:         "    end\n"
  188:         "end.\n",
  189:     "subhej" = get_erl_call_result(["-address",
  190:                                     erlang:integer_to_list(Port),
  191:                                     "-a",
  192:                                     erlang_eval_call_string(SubProcPrintStr),
  193:                                     "-fetch_stdout",
  194:                                     "-no_result_term"]),
  195:     %% Test that the remote group leader supports the multi-requests
  196:     %% request
  197:     TriggerMultiRequestsRequestStr =
  198:         "begin\n"
  199:         "    %% Create multi request\n"
  200:         "    MultiReqCollectGL =\n"
  201:         "        spawn(\n"
  202:         "          fun() ->\n"
  203:         "                  (fun GL(ReqList) ->\n"
  204:         "                           receive\n"
  205:         "                               {io_request, From, ReplyAs, Req} ->\n"
  206:         "                                   From ! {io_reply, ReplyAs, ok},\n"
  207:         "                                   GL([Req | ReqList]);\n"
  208:         "                               {get_reqs, Pid} ->\n"
  209:         "                                   Pid ! {multi_req,\n"
  210:         "                                          {requests, lists:reverse(ReqList)}}\n"
  211:         "                           end\n"
  212:         "                   end)([])\n"
  213:         "          end),\n"
  214:         "    OldGL = erlang:group_leader(),\n"
  215:         "    erlang:group_leader(MultiReqCollectGL, self()),\n"
  216:         "    io:format(\"test1\"),\n"
  217:         "    io:format(\"test2\"),\n"
  218:         "    io:format(\"test3\"),\n"
  219:         "    MultiReqCollectGL ! {get_reqs, self()},\n"
  220:         "    MultiReqsRequest =\n"
  221:         "        receive\n"
  222:         "            {multi_req, R} -> R\n"
  223:         "        end,\n"
  224:         "    erlang:group_leader(OldGL, self()),\n"
  225:         "    %% Send multi request\n"
  226:         "    erlang:group_leader() ! {io_request,self(), self(), MultiReqsRequest},\n"
  227:         "    Me = self(),\n"
  228:         "    receive {io_reply, Me, ok} -> ok end,\n"
  229:         "    %% Send normal request\n"
  230:         "    io:format(\"test4\")\n"
  231:         "end.\n",
  232:     "test1test2test3test4" =
  233:         get_erl_call_result(["-address",
  234:                              erlang:integer_to_list(Port),
  235:                              "-a",
  236:                              erlang_eval_call_string(TriggerMultiRequestsRequestStr),
  237:                              "-fetch_stdout",
  238:                              "-no_result_term"]),
  239:     ok.
  240: 
  241: %% OTP-16604: Tests that erl_call works even when the local hostname cannot be
  242: %% resolved.
  243: unresolvable_hostname(_Config) ->
  244:     Name = atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  245:         ++ "-"
  246:         ++ integer_to_list(erlang:system_time(microsecond)),
  247:     Opt = "-__uh_test__",
  248: 
  249:     try
  250:         CNodeName = start_node_and_get_c_node_name(Name, [Opt]),
  251:         [_, Hostname] = string:lexemes(atom_to_list(node()), "@"),
  252:         DefaultName = list_to_atom("c17@" ++ Hostname),
  253:         check_eq(CNodeName, DefaultName)
  254:     after
  255:         halt_node(Name)
  256:     end,
  257: 
  258:     ok.
  259: 
  260: %% OTP-16604: Test the -timeout option
  261: timeout(_Config) ->
  262:     Name = atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  263:         ++ "-"
  264:         ++ integer_to_list(erlang:system_time(microsecond)),
  265:     Opts = ["-timeout", "3"],
  266: 
  267:     try
  268:         [] = start_node_and_apply(Name, "timer sleep [10000]", Opts)
  269:     after
  270:         halt_node(Name)
  271:     end,
  272: 
  273:     ok.
  274: 
  275: %
  276: % Utility functions...
  277: %
  278: 
  279: 
  280: halt_node(Name) ->
  281:     [_, Hostname] = string:lexemes(atom_to_list(node()), "@"),
  282:     NodeName = list_to_atom(Name ++ "@" ++ Hostname),
  283:     io:format("NodeName: ~p~n~n", [NodeName]),
  284: 
  285:     pong = net_adm:ping(NodeName),
  286:     rpc:cast(NodeName, erlang, halt, []).
  287: 
  288: 
  289: start_node_and_get_node_name(Name) ->
  290:     string:trim(start_node_and_apply(Name, "erlang node", []),
  291:                 both,
  292:                 "'").
  293: 
  294: start_node_and_get_c_node_name(Name, Opts) ->
  295:     Str = start_node_and_apply(Name, "erlang nodes [hidden]", Opts),
  296:     {ok, [{'[',_}, {atom, _, CNode}, {']',_}], _} = erl_scan:string(Str),
  297:     CNode.
  298: 
  299: start_node_and_apply(Name, MfaStr, Opts) ->
  300:     NameSwitch = case net_kernel:longnames() of
  301:                      true ->
  302:                          "-name";
  303:                      false ->
  304:                          "-sname"
  305:                  end,
  306:     get_erl_call_result(Opts ++
  307:                             ["-s",
  308:                              NameSwitch,
  309:                              Name, "-a",
  310:                              MfaStr]).
  311: 
  312: start_node_and_get_port(Name) ->
  313:     start_node_and_get_node_name(Name),
  314:     {ok, NamePortList} = net_adm:names(),
  315:     {value, {_, Port}}
  316:         = lists:search(fun({N, _}) ->
  317:                                string:equal(N, Name)
  318:                        end,
  319:                        NamePortList),
  320:     Port.
  321: 
  322: get_node_name_from_self(Opts) ->
  323:     Str = apply_on_self("erlang node []", Opts),
  324:     {ok, [{atom, _, Node}], _} = erl_scan:string(Str),
  325:     Node.
  326: 
  327: apply_on_self(MfaStr, Opts) ->
  328:     get_erl_call_result(Opts ++ ["-a",MfaStr]).
  329: 
  330: find_erl_call() ->
  331:     ErlCallName = case os:type() of
  332:                       {win32, _} -> "erl_call.exe";
  333:                       _ -> "erl_call"
  334:                   end,
  335:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(erl_interface),
  336:     InstalledErlCall = filename:join([LibDir, "bin", ErlCallName]),
  337:     TargetDir = erlang:system_info(system_architecture),
  338:     TargetErlCall = filename:join([LibDir, "bin", TargetDir, ErlCallName]),
  339:     
  340:     try
  341:         lists:foreach(fun (F) ->
  342:                               io:format("Checking: \"~ts\"~n", [F]),
  343:                               case file:read_file_info(F) of
  344:                                   {ok, _} ->
  345:                                       throw(F);
  346:                                   _ ->
  347:                                       ok
  348:                               end
  349:                       end,
  350:                       [InstalledErlCall, TargetErlCall]),
  351:         exit({missing, erl_call})
  352:     catch
  353:         throw:ErlCall ->
  354:             ErlCall
  355:     end.
  356: 
  357: 
  358: get_erl_call_result(ArgsList) ->
  359:     ErlCall = find_erl_call(),
  360:     io:format("erl_call: \"~ts\"\n~nargs list: ~p~n", [ErlCall, ArgsList]),
  361:     CmdRes = get_port_res(open_port({spawn_executable, ErlCall},
  362:                                     [{args, ArgsList}, eof, stderr_to_stdout]), []),
  363:     io:format("CmdRes: ~p~n", [CmdRes]),
  364:     CmdRes.
  365: 
  366: get_port_res(Port, Acc) when is_port(Port) ->
  367:     receive
  368:         {Port, {data, Data}} ->
  369:             get_port_res(Port, [Acc|Data]);
  370:         {Port, eof} ->
  371:             lists:flatten(Acc)
  372:     end.
  373: 
  374: erlang_eval_call_string(CodeStr) ->
  375:     lists:flatten(io_lib:format("erl_eval eval_str [~w]",[CodeStr])).
